description: The case is: computenode1 and comptuenode3 share the storage from sharedstrorage1, computenode3 has local disk. The expected result from AllocationCandidates is (computenode1, sharedstorage1), (computenode2, sharedstorage1) and (computenode3). But the current return is (computenode1, sharedstorage1), (computenode2, sharedstorage1), (computenode3) and (computenode3), a duplicated (computenodes) returned.
title: AllocationCandidates return duplicated allocation requests when no sharing rp

comments.content: The case is: computenode1 and comptuenode3 share the storage from sharedstrorage1, computenode3 has local disk. The expected result from AllocationCandidates is (computenode1, sharedstorage1), (computenode2, sharedstorage1) and (computenode3). But the current return is (computenode1, sharedstorage1), (computenode2, sharedstorage1), (computenode3) and (computenode3), a duplicated (computenodes) returned.

commit 2e5f293f13e8f38e8cb6b4b58bd69d04eb808b9e
Author: He Jie Xu <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Aug 10 14:49:29 2017 +0800

    placement: avoid returning duplicated alloc_reqs when no sharing rp
    
    This patch returns from the loop early where there are no sharing
    rps, avoiding generating duplicated requests.
    
    Change-Id: I7c73b720f09bb2371770b1c6de537bb5527785a9
    Closes-Bug: #1709788
